intro: Fimbristylis microcarya var. tainanensis, commonly known as the Tainan sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
